description:
The ``mysql_grant`` resource creates and manages privileges given to
a user on a MySQL server.

tfcfnid.description: Internal identifier for tracking resource changes. Do not use.

Database.description: The database to grant privileges on.

Grant.description: Whether to also give the user privileges to grant the same privileges to other users.

Host.description: The source host of the user. Defaults to "localhost". Conflicts with `role`.

Privileges.description: A list of privileges to grant to the user. Refer to a list of privileges (such as [here](https://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.5/en/grant.html)) for applicable privileges. Conflicts with `roles`.

Role.description: The role to grant `privileges` to. Conflicts with `user` and `host`.

Roles.description: A list of rols to grant to the user. Conflicts with `privileges`.

Table.description: Which table to grant `privileges` on. Defaults to `*`, which is all tables.

TlsOption.description: An TLS-Option for the `GRANT` statement. The value is suffixed to `REQUIRE`. A value of 'SSL' will generate a `GRANT ... REQUIRE SSL` statement. See the [MYSQL `GRANT` documentation](https://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.7/en/grant.html) for more. Ignored if MySQL version is under 5.7.0.

User.description: The name of the user. Conflicts with `role`.
